actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 4, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Ms. Foxx moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT OF OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Cohen notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Jackson (IL) asked unanimous consent that he may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 4261, a bill originally introduced by Representative Payne, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.
The House observed a moment of silence in honor of an American-Israeli soldier who died in the attacks in Israel on October 7, 2023.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 366
actions-list.actionItem: 21 (Roll no. 479).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3791 — "To reauthorize the America's Conservation Enhancement Act, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motion to suspend the rules and pass S. 3791, as amended, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been posted.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 6:30 P.M. today.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 3, 2024, at 1:28 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3746, S. 4305, and H.R. 7438.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 390.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 390 — "To amend the Hudson River Valley National Heritage Area Act of 1996 (Public Law 104-333; 54 U.S.C. 320101 note) to include all of Saratoga and Washington Counties in the boundaries of the Hudson River Valley National Heritage Area."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6843.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6843 — "To expand the boundaries of the Atchafalaya National Heritage Area to include Lafourche Parish, Louisiana."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8219.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8219 — "To require the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study to assess the suitability and feasibility of designating certain land as the Lahaina National Heritage Area, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3791.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 3791 — "To reauthorize the America's Conservation Enhancement Act, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6826.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6826 — "To designate the visitor and education center at Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine as the Paul S. Sarbanes Visitor and Education Center."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7332.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7332 — "To require the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain Federal land to the State of Utah for inclusion in certain State parks, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5103.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5103 — "To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to approve or deny spend plans within a certain amount of time, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6395.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6395 — "To amend the Energy Act of 2020 to require the Secretary of the Interior to include the Secretary of Health and Human Services in consultations regarding designations of critical minerals, elements, substances, and materials."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7872.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7872 — "To amend the Colorado River Basin Salinity Control Act to modify certain requirements applicable to salinity control units, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7326.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7326 — "To amend chapters 4, 10, and 131 of title 5, United States Code, as necessary to keep those chapters current and to correct related technical errors."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7316.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7316 — "To make improvements in the enactment of title 54, United States Code, into a positive law title and to correct related technical errors."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7339.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7339 — "To make revisions in title 51, United States Code, as necessary to keep the title current, and to make technical amendments to improve the United States Code."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7341.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7341 — "To make technical amendments to title 49, United States Code, as necessary to improve the Code."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7324.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Tiffany moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7324 — "To make improvements in the enactment of title 41, United States Code, into a positive law title and to improve the Code."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9151.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hunt moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9151 — "To strengthen the Department of Justice's enforcement against trade-related crimes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9563.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hunt moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9563 — "To amend title 28, United States Code, to limit the availability of civil actions affected by United States sanctions, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8666.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Issa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8666 — "To amend title 28, United States Code, to authorize holding court for the Central Division of Utah in Moab and Monticello."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7177.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Issa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7177 — "To amend title 28, United States Code, to consolidate certain divisions in the Northern District of Alabama."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3960.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Issa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3960 — "To amend title 35, United States Code, to provide a good faith exception to the imposition of fines for false assertions and certifications, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

actions-list.header: Commission on the Future of the Navy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 1092(b)(2) of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for fiscal year 2023 (Public Law 117-263), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker and the Republican Leader of the Senate appointed Co-Chair Ms. Mackenzie Eaglen, Arlington, VA.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT OF OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Casten notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The Chair designated Mr. Casten to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Dale W. Strong to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
